text: We at KCEP 88.1 LOVE ANGIE!!! This place is something like heaven! Angie Hilbert has certainly brought her Mississippi style to Vegas and she put KCEP in a food-coma. Not only is her crackling fried chicken mouth-watering juicy, but the greens, rice, beans, rib tips, potato salad, corn, mac & cheese, corn bread, peach cobbler and banana pudding is just as gut-busting! If you're ready to really experience a party in your mouth-visit Angie's Soul Food Kitchen on 860 E. Twain, suite 102 and make this your favorite soul food restaurant.

Overall, the food was pretty good. I had the bbq chicken dinner with red beans and rice, mac n cheese, and cornbread. Food smelled delicious but the chicken was a little dry and chewy, and the mac n cheese was a little salty. I will be trying this place again, though.
This place is great, very hidden but thanks to yelp for finding it for me! The banana pudding is awesome! I'd go just for that. Underrated place

Please forgive me for having certain expectations when it comes to  my meal. I expected to have freshly cooked chicken, not old chicken placed back in hot grease. I expected to have freshly prepared desert, not slimy black banana slices. The 2 flies would not leave us alone I'm guessing because we were the only ones there. The person I tried to give the pudding to asked if they had done something wrong to deserve such a treat. No matter how much whipped cream you fold in it; it won't change the foundation of what it's not.
Super friendly staff, absolutely delicious fried chicken and okra dinner. Would definitely go back. Keep up the good work

Now I don't really leave reviews... But Angie's showed me and buddy such a good time new to las Vegas.. Finding a soul food place was kinda tricky but I went to Angie's last night and the smoothered chicken dinner with black eyed peas and mash potatoes was on point! Very flavor full and delicious from start to finish! And Mama was such a delight.. I am going back today for seconds and to bring in a new customer

Service was extremely phenomenal! The older lady who worked the counter was welcoming very friendly. Generous portions! However I don't know if they were rushing but the food was way too salty and greasy. I was expecting way better. :(

I love this place! Angie was sooo nice! Her wings were out, but as soon as she got her new order, she hooked us up! I wanna try the chicken and waffles next time, but the chicken wings were to die for! I'm craving some right now, lol.

You have to look beyond the humble environment and see the difference this place offers compared to all those NASTY CHAIN FOOD places. These WONDERFUL, SWEET people cook with their hearts to do soul food RIGHT! I will recommend them to everyone I know and I will be returning every chance I get!!!

This place was like heaven in your mouth! I went to Las Vegas a couple of weeks ago and stopped by Angie's because a friend recommended it. The food was amazing, hot, and delicious!!!! I would tell anyone to definitely stop by here you won't be disappointed!!!

So my friends and i showed up at 7:55 and they close at 8. We were going to leave but Angie insisted we at least get it to go. She gave us an awesome run down of the menu. They made it fresh and it was amazing. You can tell this place really cares about the food they make. They didn't stop smiling and she was super nice and accommodating. Customer service and atmosphere is on point with the mom and pop vibe and the fried chicken dinner was delicious

Stopped for lunch after calling ahead to order our meal.  There were a couple of empty tables so we decided to eat there rather than taking the food home.  Ordered so much goodness for the two of us that a second table was needed to hold it all.  Pig out time, and all of it was wonderful!  Cat fish, fried chicken, mac and cheese, fried corn, cornbread, black-eyed peas, cobbler, oh my!   From the first friendly hello on the phone to the last bite, a delightful experience, and one we will repeat, again and again.

While watching an episode of Triple D, I knew I wanted some REAL fried chicken, not that soggy franchise chicken dripping with grease. I was hoping to get fresh made (yes it takes about 15 minutes to get it fried up for you) delicious crispy chicken and Angie's delivered the goods. It was late Sunday afternoon, so the ladies were out of half of the sides, but I was not there for the sides, I was there for some honest fried chicken. I was not disappointed!

The chicken was perfectly cooked, moist inside and crispy outside. Light on the spices, with a good flavor to the breading and oil. My wife was not as impressed as I was, but she tends to prefer more highly spiced foods in general. She really enjoyed the sides she picked. Standard fried chicken order is a thigh and a leg, but I asked for a breast and a thigh and my wish was granted. The nice lady let me know the breast would take a little longer to cook (which I agreed it should). The tables are almost too small to eat at, but my order was to go so this was not an issue.

I did not mind waiting for the chicken to be fried because "This is not fast food, this is soul food". Next time I will call about 10 minutes ahead of time - and I know the nice ladies will take care of me just like they were my mom.

I would give it 5 stars if they had larger tables, but the chicken would likely need to cool down a bit anyway, so takeout worked perfectly for me.

Very overrated i must say. Smothered pork chop was okay lil dry and the fried corn was cool not in the top 20 though. Catfish was cool had better almost everywhere. Greens was not at all my favorite but the cabbage was okay but overall I will not be going back

Found this place on yelp and with family from down south they really wanted some good soul food so we went to try it out! 

We got 3 meals, fried chicken, smothered chicken, and rib tips all with 2 sides each for $35! Great prices for great soul food!

The fried chicken was made fresh and was very well seasoned! The ribs were good and the BBQ Sauce was tasty! The smothered chicken was delicious! The red beans and rice was outstanding we all got that and the collard greens tasted like mom use to make! With 2 pieces of warm cornbread each it was very filling!

I would def reccomend this place the service is good and friendly and the food is great! And the price is amazing we all took food home there was so much! We will be back!

Im not religious but...OH JESUS THANK YOU.

Screw this review, im going to eat!

P.s. Dont forget to call ahead and everything on the menu is good!

This was the worst imitation soul food I have ever had in my life.  I have no idea how they received such high ratings!!

After reading some reviews, my husband and I decided to pay this place a visit a couple Sunday's ago. There was a very friendly elderly lady at the register that was telling us about the menu, which is incorrect. So I ordered the turkey and stuffing, which clearly states on the menu is on Sunday's. She then tells me the menus are all wrong, they no longer offer that on Sunday. Ok, no biggie, I ordered smothered chicken, collard greens, n Mac n cheese. 
My husband ordered the same sides with smothered pork chops.  
Fast forward 45minutes, we finally received our food, since it took so long were thinking "yeah, homemade"!! Ugghh, the smothered chicken was cold in the middle, they clearly had it in the fridge and tried to warm it up #fail. The collards were old, they were warm, but had a slimy film covering it. The Mac n cheese was the best thing on our plates. I couldn't even eat this food, wasted money!  I thought I would get sick it was so disgusting. 
This was a huge disappointment, were from the south n thought we might find something more reasonably priced than Ella Ems, with the same good homestyle soul food. This is definitely not it though! 

Next time we'll go to Ella Ems, or I'll cook it myself!

I was craving some soul food. Well, I was not impressed with this place. I walked in and no workers were around to help me. There was one customer (I believe) waiting. The place looked barren, like a hollow shell, not so clean and had tacky, tattered menus that were hard to read on the walls. After waiting more than 5 minutes, I walked out. I did hear some people in the back talking and laughing. Sounded as if they were having a good time. This is not a professionally run place. I see it closing down soon.

Looking for some "good" soul food?!?!  You need to check out Angie's.  I ordered for the Christmas holiday and everything was great.  The owners welcome you when you enter and always provide the best service.

I had an opportunity to sample Angies Soul food from one of my  coworkers. It was really good so I decided to take my husband on my next off day. Well unfortunately they were closed on when we went, so we came back the next day. Soul food at such a great price and taste good...were there! Well, not only does the place smell of a "sour mop", so does Her attitude. I refuse to spend my hard earned money where it is not appreciated. If someone is new to your establishment and uncertain of the taste of a side item offer them a sample, not attitude. Not everyone eat "Fatback & Neckbones! Remember a sample can sale a plate!

In town for work and wanted to find legit food near the convention center. Angie's exceeded all expectations. Angie is super nice, the fried chicken was the best I've had in a long while, and the Mac and cheese was ridiculous. All cooked to order so there's a short wait, but it's totally worth it. Fantastic. Definitely on the top of my list for the future. Good work Angie!

This food was so good! I had smothered pork chops and the only complaint is that the dinner only includes one pork chop. My husband had smothered chicken.  My nephew had the wings and we ordered banana pudding to go. Everything was delicious. Did I mention the cornbread muffins and collard greens?

Make sure you call in your order before hand, but it is well worth the wait! I've been 3 times all getting different items each time and I haven't had a bad bite yet. Definitely strays away from anything healthy but if you want southern soul food, this is the place to go. Don't let the area fool you, real diamond in the rough...

I found Angie ' s on YELP and the reviews did not lie. Some BIG Conference attendees and myself had the catfish and baked chicken -off da chain. And the sides (mac n cheese, greens, Potatoe salad and yams) were delicious. Big thx to Angie and her Mom's for taking care of us DC brothers .

Superb bird in da hood! Fried up all fresh and crixpy like, like ya like it! I am a wee bit of a ghetto bird fan and I will tell you that THIS is the current Heavyweight Champ of LV by a mile. All bird is made to order...translated: order your bird and be prepared to set a bit...and when it comes out to you it will be BURN YO MOUTH hot and DELICIOUS! Slap on some hot sauce and start smiling!

If this is considered soul food I feel really bad for Vegas.  They must know nothing about real food. 
I ordered 2 chicken plates. 6 wings. Two banana pudding and peach cobbler.  Not one thing was cooked how it should have been. 
Soggy fries even. Burn cornbread. Terrible peach cobbler. Chewy chicken on the wings. Over cooked leg and thighs. Hard beans in the rice and beans. Mashed potatoes like them spent all day under a buffet light. 
I will never go back.

I FINALLY found a joint whose chicken and waffles rivals the famous Roscoe's Chicken Waffles. Angie's doesn't just slap chicken and waffles together and calls it a day. The combo tastes like a true combo. The chicken is tender and tasty. The waffles are well "seasoned" with cinnamon and powdered sugar along with the perfect consistency for chicken. 
For old times sake, I gulped down some grape kool-aid. Took me back!
Moreover, service was excellent. A true "down home" experience.

The soul food is amazing. Probably the best in Las Vegas.

Seriously, go here.

My roommate had the fried chicken dinner with collard greens and potato salad. The fried chicken was so crunchy! 

I had the turkey and stuffing dinner with Mac n cheese and potato salad. The turkey was succulent and flavourful. The sides were delicious and it was more than enough food to fill me up.

As soon as you walk in you are met with a warm and comforting greeting. Angie and faith are all smiles and talk to you. They ask how you are doing not just straight to what do you want. They are very caring and it shows in the taste of the food. Delicious! You are missing out on some good home style cooking if you don't come here. Angie and faith literally pour their hearts into the food they make and the service that they provide. When you leave, your stomach will be satisfied and heart will feel good. Thank you Angie and Faith.  I will absolutely be back again. Thank you!

Really hole in the wall joint.  Friendly service.  If you're expecting fast food, this isn't the place to go.  They make your food fresh to order.  Not the best southern style cooking I had.  You can tell the oil they use to fry their food has not been changed in a while.  The food was tasty enough to satisfy my appetite, but I won't be coming back.

First I want to say, the food here is amazing. The chicken was fried to perfection. The sides were all wonderful. I've never had better red beans and rice. The chicken and waffle is an amazing deal. The waffle was flavorful and i ate it with the chicken  like a sandwich. The sweet lady that helped me made me feel like I was in the kitchen talking with my grandmother. The quality of food is worth supporting this business and the owners. You will not regret stopping here.

This place is so unassuming, but then again most of the best restaurants are in my opinion. We wandered in on a Tuesday and both ordered chicken and dumplings. Some meals are only available certain days. $9.99 dinner entrees are perfect for the working man. Burgers under $5. The chicken and dumplings, greens and mac and cheese were amazing, just as good as my grandmothers if not better. The banana pudding was a taste of my childhood I forgot and Angie does it really well. Would return again on a Sunday for the oxtail dinner or gumbo. The sign at the register says it all "this is not fast good it is soul food".

Ooowee! That's some good soul food right there! Please don't be deterred by the area tho. They close at 8 pm and I believe they are closed on Mondays. It's better to call before you go because it can be a bit of a wait. Service was great and the food even better. 

I had the red snapper dinner with mac & cheese and collard greens. It came with a yummy piece of cornbread as well. For the drink I had the red kool-aid... BOMB! Banana pudding was for dessert... Mmmph! Delicious 

The hubby had the smothered chicken dinner with mac & cheese and mashed potatoes and gravy. Needless to say he thought everything was so good he wanted to give Angie a foot rub after she done put her feet all up in our meals lol. We'll definitely be back!

Thank God for Angies. Finally great soul food in Sin City. Everything was great, smothered chicken, corn, mashed potatoes, kool aid it's all good. Great service, friendly people highly recommend best food in the neighborhood hands down. Don't miss out lightning doesn't strike twice lol.

You walk in a are immediately welcomed by the cashier. I ordered smothered chicken, mac and cheese and black-eyed peas. I heard her mention they had peach cobbler so gave that a go as well. The chicken was delicious and juicy. The 
mac-n-cheese and black-eyed peas were awesome and the cornbread was just like my mom used to make. If yelp had 6 stars they would get it.

We'd been meaning to visit this place and were pleasantly surprised when we finally did. We recently moved here from Florida, where southern (soul) food can be found almost everywhere. 

The plaza and surrounding area looks a little shady, but for the most part everything is just run down. Don't let that deter you, the food, price and service make it all worth it. 

There is seating inside for around 10 people, but it looks like people like to carry out for the most part. Because of the building itself, the inside doesn't look fantastic; however, you can tell it is clean, and they did a good job decorating to brighten the place up. 

You will be quickly greeted by the a woman who can say the entire menu without breathing in less than 30 seconds - it is pretty amazing! She was very kind and genuine, it reminded me of what we like to call 'real southern hospitality'. They have all the normal options, everything from chicken and waffles to oxtail; there are also weekly specials.

We ordered: chicken and waffles ($4.99), chicken wings (3 whole) and fries ($4.99), and a fried chicken dinner ($9.99). We received 4 wings instead of 3, and there were a slice of toasted bread. My husband got mashed potatoes and macaroni and cheese as his dinner sides, and a cornbread muffin was included. 

Everything was pretty good, we didn't really have any complaints. The macaroni and cheese was outstanding though, so I will be going back for that!

Both of us give the place a 4 because it wasn't the BEST in the whole world; however, it will definitely become a place we frequent. As I said, the amount of food we can get for $20, the quality of service and the fact that it is soul food (MmmMm!) makes it worth the trip.

If your in a rush don't stop here I ordered peach cobbler and didn't have any peaches more like cinnamon water dumplings food was good ordered meatloaf Mac and cheese beans and rice but it wasn't great for the price I will rather go to Mario's

If you want soul food in Vegas, you only have a few options- Angie's fell a bit short of my expectations, but I was spoiled by a childhood in the south. Location is small, mostly takeout, and not in the best of neighborhoods, but service is as sweet as your own grandma.

SMOTHERED PORK CHOPS: Well, the chop was good, but they forgot to smother it. Since this was takeout, I didn't find out til I got home across town. Mac and cabbage sides were both fairly good and clearly homemade, but I'm really bummed about the mistake with the porkchop, as it's my favorite southern dish.
SPARE RIB DINNER: Ribs were mostly fat but I really liked the sauce used. Sides of black eyed peas and mashed potatoes were both kind of off, peas were very heavily seasoned and potatoes barely had any gravy (maybe they were running out?) and texture was gummy.
WINGS: They sell full size wings here, and my guy really enjoyed them. They're not sauced, just fried. Boxed to go on top of a bed of super-greasy broken fries, like the bottom of the basket when no one wants to make more. 
BANANA PUDDING: Ordered one and got one free, which was nice of them. Tasted just like my mom used to make it, simple and delicious. 

This place has a lot of promise, but some dishes were significantly better than others. Maybe they should tighten up the menu and drop some things they aren't executing as well. I don't come around this side of town often, but I'll try to keep this spot in mind for another visit for the smothered chops... and I'll check my order before leaving.

Come here about 3 or 4 times a month!! The area is pretty shady, but it's right up the street from the police station. Service is amazing !! Give it a 4 for the cleanness !! 

Now let's get on the food: 

Angies food is extremely good but it not consistent. There's days it taste salty and days it tastes dry. She just needs to be more consistent with her measurement. But overall a great place for the low prices !!!
Can't really comment because I came on normal business hours and at normal time at 4pm and they were closed no sign no nothing . Kinda disappointing.

We found Angie's while looking for a place to eat away from the Strip.  The food was authentic and served hot.  Loved the welcoming atmosphere, I felt like I was in someone's home.  Fried chicken dinner with greens was my favorite.  Stop by if you are in town!!

Great Southern food.  We had the fried chicken, fried pork chops, and vegetables.  All were delicious.

Only drawback is the Sketchy location;  go during broad daylight.

WOW......... This place is a hidden gem. I found Angies soul food by accident and called ahead to be sure they were open. I had the pleasure of speaking with Angie 
on the phone and she told me she had red snapper today. I was on my way!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!
Upon entering, I was greeted with a friendly smile which was Angie. I told her I was 
the one who called and I proceeded to order  small chicken plate and a side of 
Red Snapper. Both were fantastic and  this may be the BEST fried chicken                 in Las Vegas.  Perfectly deep fried with great tasting, crispy batter. Portion sizes were very generous.  My sides were Homemade macaroni and cheese, along with some collard greens. Both sides were delicious. While I was waiting for my order to cook, Angies mom came out from the kichen and she was a pleasure to talk with. I believe her and her daughter split the cooking duties.
    I will not only be returning to Angies to eat but will also be recommending 
Angies to many people as this place provides great food made by some really 
nice people.
The greens, cabbage and mac and cheese were super delicious and the best part is they were served hot and didn't get cold the entire time I ate them!

Fried chickens...On point! 
Catfish and Ribs...On point! 
Red beans, Mac&cheese, collard greens...ON POINT!! The food is great!!!
I THINK YOU GET THE POINT!

Not impressed at all. Unfortunately the greens tasted like canned greens, the yams were hard, the mac and cheese was overbaked and hard in many areas, the ribs were full of fat, and the chicken was very oily. The best thing we had was the red beans and rice. After reading multiple wonderful reviews we were so disappointed.  Perhaps it was an off day or maybe our California palates are just not accustomed to this soul food. They were friendly and we did wait patiently for our food to come at its best as they do cook it fresh. Too bad it was not a hit for us.

While visiting from San Diego we stumbled upon this restaurant and boy are we happy we did! We called 20 minutes before they closed and they stayed open late to cook our order. We had a smothered chicken meal, fried catfish, and fried chicken meal. ...Wow! The fried okra was awesome! Chicken crispy,  fish seasoned perfectly and everything was just screamin' Like the sign says it is not fast food, it'soul food....it's definitely worth the wait. Very nice people working there, you can tell they care and it sure does show in the quality of their food.
WOW!! the best soul food in town. if you haven't been here you're missing out. Homemade food at its best with great service. TRY IT TODAY
I support black business, the lady at the front desk was kind and very detailed about the menu, waiting on my food now, I'll let you know how it tastes
Nice people, came from Chicago to try it out. The kook-aid and banana pudding are a must try.

When we walked in the door we were greeted by the sweetest little old lady! she blew me away with how she could recite the menu without taking a breath, lol. Anyhoo, I had the fried chicken and french fries......OMG! it was like the food my mom used to make. The chicken was piping hot, crispy and seasoned just right and the fries were like the ones my mom used to make where she would cut them with the skin still on. 
Overall it wasn't bad, I do have to admit though, the neighborhood isn't the best so if you're a single woman stopping by to pick up a bite to eat before she gets home, my suggestion is that you call ahead and order your food so it will be done by the time you get there so you don't have to leave your car alone for too long. (IJS)
Also, if you blink you'll miss it, the signage is very small and not very noticeable.

I was in Vegas about a week ago and swung by this place looking for somewhere to eat and meaning to do the review ever since.

Great food for the price and Angie is the sweetest lady. Got me 3 huge wings and Fries for $4.99 and could not complain about the food. The menu is a bit weird considering half of everything listed is crossed out. 

Just a heads up it takes 10-20 minutes for your food to be prepared

angie makes my day when i go in for my chicken and waffles and corn bread. her and her mother are the sweetest people ive met here in vegas. i highly suggest popping in for some comfort food. thanks angie for the best chicken and waffles :)

The food here reminds me of the food I had growing up and visiting my grandma's house. I can't wait to try her other items. Next time I will call ahead and carry out as suggested in other reviews.  We ordered the smothered chicken with rice, potato salad, yams, macaroni & cheese & chitterlings.  I arrived 15 minutes after they opened on a Sunday. Next time I will wait at least an hour before going to ensure everything is ready. 

PROS: The gravy
             Service

CONS: Out of the fried corn
             Out of coleslaw
             Arrived too early for oxtails and peach cobbler

This is not fast food. More of a call ahead and takeout place but we ate in the small eating area and the food was worth the wait.   Fried chicken and fried catfish are crispy outside and tender and juicy on the inside.  Collard greens, mashed potatoes and gravy, red beans and rice and yams all yummy with good seasoning.  The cornbread muffins were warm and moist.  Sooo Good.!! Angie and her mom are both really nice and enjoyed talking to them while we waited.  Can't wait to try the peach cobbler and banana pudding next time.

One of my friends was craving fried chicken as we were leaving our Spring Break weekend of debauchery. Thankfully, I had my trusty Yelpers to assist me in finding Angie's Soul Food Kitchen, which is actually not too far from the Strip! While the plaza it's located in is a bit dingy, and the restaurant very small, the food was pretty good! I ordered the $3.99 Chicken and Waffles. Disclaimer: it really is only ONE piece of chicken with ONE waffle. I wish I had ordered the fried chicken platters that were on the menu because it was finger lickin' good! I also ordered the creamed corned, which was delicious, sweet, and had savory bits of bacon and onion in it. I wish I had visited on a day that their banana cream pie/pudding was available! It sounds delicious from the other reviews I read. 

Overall, I would definitely give this place a try if you're ever in the area and craving fried chicken. The staff is super friendly! It's like going to your grandma's for a bite to eat! Just be aware that cash is recommended and there are literally only about 2-3 tables in the place.

So frustrating!

LV is such a great foodie city yet you cannot find Chicken and Dumplings anywhere in town!

...except Angie's Soul Food Kitchen, and only on Tues, at least as shown on this website. Waited thru Mon to get to Tues for the special. Drove across town to get there. Upon arrival, the sign on the door says closed on Tues.  How can you only serve the Chicken and Dumpling special on the one day you are closed?

The food may be as great as the reviews indicate, but I will never know.

Learned my lesson.....

The best soul food I've ever had!  I couldn't wait to write this review because I am so excited I finally found a good soul food place in Vegas.  

I got the catfish dinner and I got the fried chicken dinner for my brother.  I asked him how his was and with a mouthful all he said was "it's good as ****".  I got the collard greens and fried okra for my sides and both were exceptional.  The greens were cooked how greens are supposed to be cooked (with ham) and the right seasonings.  The fried okra was the best I've ever had, they were crispy and not soggy like some places.  The catfish was also fantastic!  It was fresh and breaded and fried how catfish should be (crispy, not soggy).  Whatever they use to bread the catfish and the okra is perfect.  I cannot express with words how my taste buds danced when I ate my catfish, greens, and fried okra.

Last, but certainly not least, the owner was absolutely charming and it is clear that she is the type of person who genuinely cares about her business.  Isn't it always easier to spend money places where you feel like they really appreciate your business?

If you are looking for excellent soul food, look no further!  This place is doing soul food how it should be done!

This place is a hidden discovery. Food was freshly prepared. So call and order ahead of time. The fish,chicken,corn bread and mac n cheese was gud. However the fried corn was the BEST I've ever had!! Oh...don't forget to top it off with some banana pudding. I will make sure to visit this hidden jewel anytime I come back to Vegas:+)

The fried catfish was remarkable along with the sides.
I didn't have Kool - Aid in a long time and thought I should have some, bad idea waaay to sugary. But I did preserve it by adding water though. Overall it was great. A must have.

WAYYY!! overpriced for the trashy quality food everything that I had ordered tasted horrible or was over cooked and I waited forever to receive my food I WILL NEVER eat their food again And The restaurant didn't look very sanitized I suggest you go somewhere else

I happened upon Angie's on Thanksgiving eve.  I was desperately looking for a place that would take my rush holiday pie order and after a dozen "No's", Angie's sweet kindness let me in from the dark and shined a light on me that warms me to this day.  She said that she didn't exactly have anything ready, but asked me to come in and we would "talk"; Southern speak for, "we'll work it out".   
When I had arrived at the location, a lady greeted me with a hearty hello and called for Angie to come out from the back.   Based on her enthusiasm, I just naturally assumed I was speaking with Angie.  When Angie came out with her big smile, I reminded her of who I am and she hesitatingly said that she does have a pie but it's in her personal pie tin and not very professional looking.  I excitedly exclaimed, "That's PERFECT!"  I know I'm dragging on here but what I want you to see is that Angie and the lady who greeted me so enthusiastically, who I later found out was Angie's Mother, are the most kind, humble and positive people I've met in a long time.  

I took the pie, which was a great deal, with a small stack of menus and delivered the pie to my friends with a copy of the menu.  On my way back home, I was hungry for lunch so I called Angie's and placed a "take out" order.  If you decide to visit Angie's I recommend calling in advance and order "take out".  

Always on the prowl for home cooking and fried chicken I ordered the... Now don't judge.  I intended to buy part 1 for lunch and part 2 for dinner but sometimes the food is just too good and well...you know...things happen.  Anyway, I ordered the nine piece wings and fries and for my "intended" dinner, I ordered the fried chicken dinner with two sides: Collard Greens and Red Beans and Rice.  Angie said it will be ready in 30 minutes.  I also wanted to stop by to let the ladies know how much my friends I and appreciated and loved the sweet potato pie.   When I told Angie, she was very grateful for the positive feedback.

Now to the good stuff... My orders came in two, 3-section, Styrofoam, to-go boxes inside a plastic bag.  I could feel the heat on my fingers and smell the scent of fried chicken emanating from the bag.  I got in my car and barely got the key in the ignition before I had that knot on that bag ripped open like an excited five year old on Christmas morning.  I popped open that first Styrofoam container and found a mound of REAL French fried potatoes, and NINE golden chicken wings.  Remember that scene from "Pulp Fiction" where the briefcase was opened and a gold glow was cast on the face of John Travolta?  That was me.  Do not tell on me but I am driving during this segment of the review.  I'm hungry and going to "nibble" a bit while I drive.   My first pull, I took in one fry and was blown away with it's freshness and that "comfort food" feeling it gave me;  hot, fresh, perfectly salty and real food not processed or "extruded"     Now I'm pulling up four and five fries per reach.  They are hot and moist and taste so good but then my fingers touch a faint rough texture versus the smoothness of the French Fry.  It's the first tactile introduction of the fried CHICKEN WINGS!!!  I'm at a stop light now and can use both hands to pull apart the pointy side of the wing.  Not much meat but I love the crunch and it's perfectly seasoned!!!   So nice and so good!  I then place the center piece with the moist flesh covered by the fried, crispy, salty goodness.  Not sure where the bones went.  Then la piece de la resistance, the meaty end; not huge like some hormone fed Frankenchicken, but perfect.  I can't put it to words.  You're just going to have to get your lips on some so you can feel the love.  

I live about 6 miles from Angie's, a drive I barely remember.  When I pulled onto my street, I discovered I was not wearing my seat-belt!  I ALWAYS wear my seat belt!  I can't remember a time when I didn't wear it.  This is some amazing food!  

I pulled into my garage looking at the passenger seat, there is one more box left.  The debate erupts in my head, "put it away, "just have a taste", "put it away", "just one bite"...back and forth, but gluttony won this day. I sat at my dinner table with fork and napkins...plural.  Intending to just "taste" the collards and red beans and rice, then retire the rest of the meal for dinner I soon realized that I should have just walked away and put the box in the refrigerator.  First bite and it was over.  The Collards were seasoned perfectly and so tender with  bite sized chucks of smoked ham hock and the red beans and rice reminded me of food my Grand Mother, who's from Jefferson County Alabama, used to make.  I was sucked in.  Then there is the perfect mounds of happiness in the cornbread.   Next thing I know, the plate's empty.  Only the bones remained and I'm stuffed.  This is genuinely one of those great meals where the food tastes so good you just keep eating no matter how full you are.  

Amen

We were looking for lunch, and I stumbled upon this gem!

To be fair, the 3 stars are based off my chicken only meal lol. I called and asked about their lunch plates, basically you can only order a dinner with 2 pieces of chicken, 2 sides, and 2 corn breads for 9.99! To me that was a little pricey so I asked how much the individual chicken pieces were and they were drastically less expensive. I purchased a breast and a leg for 3.49! My friend purchased the dinner, and it was quite a bit of food, but I'm still a cheap butt and wouldve rather just ordered my way.

The chicken itself is super juicy and the breading is actually not greasy and gross! It's pretty yummy! It may have a little too much salt though, which is rare for me to say because I love salt! The customer service here is nice, she added that a tip isnt required, but is appreciated. 

The actual location is small and in a shopping mall. Pay close attention otherwise you'll miss it!

Yay!
I finally found a good soul food place Thanks to Angie and Mama I'll definitely be back

Best Sweet Potato Pie I've ever had. You can pre order a whole one and be the star of the potluck or holiday get together!   Angie is on premises every time I've been there and you can tell how much pride she takes in her shop.

Food was good and service was the best ever! I had the smoothered chicken, cornbread & the banana pudding & Kool-aid was not my favorite but the sweetest ladies ever!! Not really set up to eat there but they treated us so good that I didn't mind.

worse wings and fries I've ever had. my meal came out so dark like it was cooked in old grease. the taste was horrible, I threw it out before I got out of the parking lot. very disappointed. I would have returned it but there was and older woman working and I felt bad.

We just had the fried chicken , greens, cabbage , mac& cheese, mashed potatoes & corn muffins. Everything was very good & the people were great- it is real home cooking , small business @ it's best they are happy to have you & you can tell it. Tried to come yesterday but they are closed tuesdays-10 min off strip & again you get great value & quality- we will be back

My husband, two five-year-olds, and I stopped in at Angie's Soul Food for a late lunch. We had red beans and rice, corn, a hot dog and fries, ox tails on rice, and chicken and waffles. I've never had chicken and waffles together before. They were great. My children both loved them. The red beans and rice were good and spicy. All good home cooking. Family run and very friendly. We will definitely come again the next time we are in Las Vegas.

Thanks yet again to the Yelp app for finding my lunch.  I typed in "soul food," and this place appeared.  It had half a dozen glowing reviews, so we decided to give it a shot.  Very glad we did.  Angie is very friendly, I stopped by before we ate and got a to go menu.  She advised me to call and order what we wanted, as the food is cooked to order, and it is not quick.  This is totally fine with me, I find that generally, the quicker stuff is, the less "real" it is.  And usually, the better it tastes when it takes some time to cook.

There are some mainstays on the menu (fried or smothered chicken, for example), and there are daily specials.  We ate at Angie's on a Thursday, when meatloaf is the special.  So, my wife had meatloaf.  This is a traditional meatloaf, tomato sauce, onions, veggies.  Very moist, went well with the mashed potatoes and brown gravy.  We also tried mac n cheese, fried corn, and okra.  Of these, the okra was my least favorite, but I still really liked it.  The fried corn has bacon and veggies in it, it was a style we hadn't tried before.  Both of us liked it.  I'd like to try to replicate this dish at home.  The mac n cheese, as expected, was fantastic.  Classic soul food mac, not based on a roux.  Very cheesy.  

I had the fried chicken.  I was glad I called ahead, because this dish can take 25-30 minutes.  Again, I don't mind since it's fresh, but I highly recommend you call first.  This is a LARGE serving of chicken, 4 pieces, with 2 very large drumsticks.  Both meals at $9.99 for the entrée, 2 sides, and cornbread.  Very reasonable considering the flavor and quality of what you get.  The fried chicken was seasoned very well.  I find that a lot of places are too focused on the skin, which is certainly important, and leave out proper seasoning.  Not Angie.  The skin was crispy, adhered to the chicken, and was flavorful.  That's the fried chicken trifecta.

The employees were very friendly.  The place is small and sparsely decorated, but we felt very comfortable.  This is some serious soul food, highly recommended.
The food was so fucking nasty chicken was greasy gravy was sour green were awful who cant make green 11 dollars in the trash
If I could actually give this place no stars I would. The food is horrible. It would probably be a little different if they changed the grease that they cook their food in.

Angie can cook.  But there are some items that need to be "tweeked" The food is flavored well and has a pleasant aftertast.  You can sit down and eat here but I would bill it as take out.  No, its not top notch soul food, that does not exist in vegas, but it makes an attempt at southrn cuisine and does well in some areas more than others.  I am NOT  a fan of the mac and cheese which is in dire need of an updated recipe.  The smothered meals are worth the visit as well as the banana pudding.  The flavors can be a bit strong and less than traditional, for example the cabbage, corn, meat loaf and mashed could benefit from a more traditional recipe update.  I believe black people, especially, should support Angies as much if not more than they support the chinese food. I also believe Angie should grow and work on her quality and finding knockout recipes that will truly compliment her vision and business.

I love soul food but this place was not great at all. The place itself was not that clean. I'd seen an ant on the floor and the floor needed to be mopped. The lady that took our order was very nice and helpful. I ordered smothered chicken (tastes yummy)  with corn bread (tastes good. Tastes just like jiffy cornbread), yams (gross. not soft and tasted pretty bland) & collard greens (the worst. Way too much garlic salt. Wasn't seasoned correctly at all). The person I was with let me taste their red snapper fish (great!) & mac n cheese (very good!) .. the food took forever to cook. The next day after eating this food for dinner, I felt sick: stomach ache & very soft stool all morning. Not going here again.

Customer service was great. Food was very salty. I'm from Alabama and I can say, it was southern cooking for real. But too expensive and too salty, and yes, took 30 minutes to get food. Also of note, my girlfriend thinks the catfish got her sick. That said, best banana pudding I've ever eaten. Better than Lola's for you local foodie's. If you want soul food in Vegas, go to M & M's. Much better. Much faster. Much cheaper.

After spending an hour searching for a decent soul food joint close to Henderson I stumbled upon Angie's Soul Food Kitchen and decided give it a try. My taste buds and my belly were happy to have found Angie's to say the least. Angie herself is a sweetheart and greets you right when you walk in. The food, to note, is made to order so prepare to wait. My fried chicken dinner with a side of greens and red beans with rice was piping hot when ready. The chicken was cooked to perfection, the greens were seasoned just right, and the red beans and rice just melt in your mouth. Though I'm still a devout fan of Kathy's Soul food Kitchen, minus the lack thereof of proper serving etiquette (a whole other story), I like that I have just as good an option to choose from now when needing a soul food fix. Do check this place out if you're in the boulevard mall area, its definitely worth the trip.

We have been trying to place a pick up order over the phone for 30 minutes now...its 12:15 PM here in Vegas and no one is answering their phone. The sign days they open at 11 AM. I see another review where someone else had the same problem. This is very sad...if this was good tasting my co-workers and I were ready to make this a regular lunch spot. Oh, well...on to the next one!!!

I ordered the fried chicken dinner and it was DELICIOUS !!!! The Mac and cheese and Corn bread are so good !!' And Angie's mom Alice was such a sweetheart. The food and the hospitality was above and beyond !!! If you are in Vegas this is a must visit !!

Just went there for the first time tonight, based on the reviews.  Called in advance for takeout per the recommendations (thanks Yelpers!).  Got the fried chicken dinner with collard greens and mac and cheese.  Peach cobbler for dessert. When we got there, they were just finishing the dishes, which took about an extra 5 minutes (so we were checking out the menu!).

First of all, we got to meet Angie, who popped out of the kitchen to say hello.  Angie's Momma was behind the counter - she is such a darling and makes you feel like you are part of their family right away.

Most importantly, the food:  This isn't just food, its a religious experience.  These ladies are so gifted.  Oh my goodness.  

Everything is homemade and you can absolutely tell.  The fried chicken is the best I've had, hands down (and I lived in Kentucky!). Crispy without a touch of greasiness.  Meat was fall off the bone tender  The collard greens have big hunks of ham hocks and seasoned just right.  The mac and cheese - oh man, the mac and cheese.  I'm trying to pinpoint it, but I think it may be cheddar, swiss and a bit of gruyere.  This is the mac & cheese you find in a five star restaurant for $20.  It can only be described as elegant.  The blend of flavors just flows so beautifully.

The peach cobbler smelled like heaven and tasted even better, with nutmeg and ginger.

I am so glad I found this place and cannot wait to try everything else!

When needing that SOUTHERN food fix, this is WHERE I come!!!!

The Peach COBBLER will send you OVER the TOP!!!!!

The fried chicken and fish are FINGER LICKING GOOD! 

Get take-out to ensure you don't have a long wait for seating.

I loved every single bite. 
I ordered the fried chicken with the Mac and cheese and collard greens. It came with cornbread. And I got KoolAid to round it out.

Every bite was flavorful, but not in that overly salted way. It was great! The chicken was crispy and delicious. I added hot sauce, out of habit, but it definitely didn't need it. The haters through the comments complaining that it was greasy or salty, are probably used to eating special sodium restricted diets. The greens were amazing. The Mac and cheese was way above what I expected. I loved every bite and the closer to the end of my meal I got the sadder I got that the experience was going to be over. 

My husband got the smothered chicken with red beans and rice and Mac and cheese. He loved it so much he didn't say a word while eating. He just looked at me and kept nodding and looking up. 

I can't believe I've spent a year in Las Vegas and this is the first time I've eaten here. This will be one of the places my family and I will miss when we go back East.
Had the ribs, mac and cheese, rice and beans. Ribs were fall off the bone and quite tasty. Mac and cheese average, beans and rice pretty good. Very small restaurant, good prices.
Food was awesome no season needed the rice was off da hook. Very friendly staff will b back soon

Wow, awesome food.  I ordered the smothered chicken meal with cabbage and mashed potatoes and gravy.  It also came with a cornbread muffin which was perfect.  The portion size was huge and the chicken was fried fresh.  Really hot and crispy with delicious gravy.  I would give the food 5 stars, but only gave 4 stars because of the wait time.  I went with 4 people and it took almost 40 minutes to get our food which sucks when you're hungry and on lunch break.  Also, they were out of a few things but besides that, this place is amazing.  Next time I'm hoping to try the catfish and the Mac n cheese and greens (they were out this time). The ladies working were very sweet and hospitable.  I'd definitely return but I would call ahead first! Go check this place out!
